@rusler18 The data needed for LOI teams to succeed in Europe is there. It comes down to interpretation and application now.
@rusler18 there is...and a distinct difference in the transfer of the data/analytics to the pitch.
@GerMcDermott @rusler18 that's why top teams playing against each other in lead up to Europe could be crucial component to success
@rusler18 I would imagine the clubs involved most certainly have this information
@GerMcDermott @rusler18 merely reducing the margins in European teams' favour until we get ourselves to a higher level
@GerMcDermott @rusler18 not necessarily. We are using it to train players to be able to adapt until we can compete technically.
@rusler18 exactly but do teams actually know comparisons of average spells with/without ball v recovery times in European games v LOI ones?
@GerMcDermott @rusler18 if we can't keep the ball Ger, we have to train to less in-game recovery times to give ourselves a better chance
@rusler18 periodise training to European levels and get top 4 teams to play each other in weeks leading into Europe to get to that intensity
@rusler18 substantially higher than in LOI games, as is time and work rate without the ball.
@rusler18 have studied it intensely since 2011 when Rovers qualified for Europa group stages. Time the ball is in play in European games is
@rusler18 to an extent. Teams need that momentum going into Europe. Top teams should be playing V each other in run up to European games
@MickRing83 You have just made my day!! #leg(pronouncedLedge! )
@rusler18 Takes better in-game recovery strategy for longer spells without the ball than teams get in LOI games.

@SimonGleave @joeferrelly @thevideoanalyst Individual players have individual KPI's within each set piece.
@SimonGleave @joeferrelly @thevideoanalyst It is when you're working on you own KPI's as oppose to industry trends
@SimonGleave @joeferrelly @thevideoanalyst Clubs do innovate like that but the intricacies are kept in-house by the manager
@SimonGleave @joeferrelly @thevideoanalyst Then you're aware that in some clubs the Head Analyst has never even spoken to first team manager
@SimonGleave @joeferrelly @thevideoanalyst more traditional methods. Football analysis, like rugby has become more in-house & team specific
@SimonGleave @joeferrelly @thevideoanalyst not really sure you're aware of the type of in-house analysis that is now being preferred to the
@SimonGleave @joeferrelly @thevideoanalyst No because if the analyst understands football there is no requirement for a translator. Plus I'm
@SimonGleave @joeferrelly @thevideoanalyst Managers want to know what data means in football terms not analytical terms. Its that simple
@SimonGleave @joeferrelly @thevideoanalyst The real gap exists in the transfer of the analysis to the training pitch so in-game margins sway
@SimonGleave @joeferrelly @thevideoanalyst That's the route modern football has been going for last 5 years. Everything is football specific
@SimonGleave @joeferrelly @thevideoanalyst manager I work with did his degree in Mathematics & Statistics.  That's the way football's going!
@SimonGleave @joeferrelly @thevideoanalyst My point is that football people are taking qualifications in these subjects. For example, one
@SimonGleave @joeferrelly @thevideoanalyst Read this. Teams are analysing individual players though & impact of opposition. It is complex
@SimonGleave @joeferrelly @thevideoanalyst If you knew football, you'd know the questions. That's all I'm saying. It cuts out a middle man!
@SimonGleave @joeferrelly @thevideoanalyst Where do normal football possession stats account for opp teams pressing high/defending deep?
@joeferrelly @SimonGleave @thevideoanalyst They're not football stats though. They're football performance stats. There's a big difference
@joeferrelly @SimonGleave @thevideoanalyst Of course but for day to day stuff & for real trend analysis the fundamentals have to be right
@joeferrelly @SimonGleave @thevideoanalyst Baseball is not a contact sport - far less variables so more of an exact science
@joeferrelly @SimonGleave @thevideoanalyst In football you have 11 players(11 different positions/roles within a unit)11 opponents & referee
